alert.note: Alert for Harris; Waller (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 2:31PM CDT until May 17 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Houston/Galveston TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... West Fork San Jacinto near Humble affecting Harris and Montgomery Counties. Cypress Creek at Katy-Hockley Road affecting Waller and Harris Counties. San Bernard River near Boling affecting Fort Bend, Wharton and Brazoria Counties. ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Texas... Lake Creek at Sendera Ranch Road affecting Montgomery County. .Additional rainfall is possible which could lead to increases in stage levels. For the West Fork San Jacinto River...including Sendera Ranch Road, Humble...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Cypress Creek...including Katy-Hockley Road...Minor flooding is forecast. For the San Bernard River...including Boling...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON TO LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cypress Creek at Katy-Hockley Road. * WHEN...From Monday afternoon to late Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 157.3 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins in the vicinity of the gage as water escapes the main channel and spills into the floodplain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:45 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 154.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 157.9 feet late tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 157.3 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 158.3 feet on 10/18/2006. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (2 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Cypress Creek Katy-Hockley Roa 157.3 154.3 Sun 12 pm CD 157.5 157.6 156.2 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 230 AM CDT.
